st_af_itcher_descr:
A formation of thermal nature. The Itcher consists of two separated layers. The surface is a hard, dense metamorphic rock with deep scars covering the entire body. Completely inactive and doesn't hold any noticeable properties. On the other hand, the soft, yellow glowing core is from unknown organic nature. It actively consumes excessive heat and remains cool at all times.
		
However, it is not recommended to approach chemical and acid anomalies when in possession of the artefact as it will increase the adverse effects of acids and toxins in user's bloodstream.
		
 
Radiation output is low on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_pin_descr:
A small artefact formed by thermal anomalies in the Zone under extreme temperatures. The look of this artefact suggests that it was an organ of a vascular plant. Further studies showed that other organic tissues are fused deep inside.
		
The stem doesn't hold any useful properties. On the contrary, the small pins reduce temperature of user's body and cool all objects in their vicinity.
		
This artefact offers a slight psy-protection as it will resonate under the influence of psy-waves. On the other hand, it is not recommended to approach chemical and acid anomalies when in possession of the artefact as it will increase the adverse effects of acids and toxins in user's bloodstream.
		
 
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_cristall_descr:
This artefact is formed in anomalous zones with intense thermal activity. Actively consumes excessive heat and remains cool at all times.
		
It will also protect the user against electrical currents. On the other hand, exposure to such environments makes the artefact increase the conductivity due to unknown as of now mechanism. For this reason, one is forced to weigh pros and cons of Crystal when in the vicinity of areas of high conductivity.
		
This artefact is also highly sought for by jewellers outside the Zone as its inner core is not radioactive and considered to be of exceptional beauty if polished and refined. Only the first 1 cm of its outer layer emits radiation.
		
It is, however, highly advised to proceed with caution when planning to bring the artefact to the market as prolonged exposure to even minimal amounts of radioactive materials can result in death of the user. Covered with very hard layer. Relatively heavy due to high density.
		
 
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_fireball_descr:
It is a spherical artefact made of red-coloured crystal, created in the Burner anomaly.
		
It has an unique property: it has a constant temperature of 75 degrees Fahrenheit/24 degrees Celsius, regardless of its surroundings. This allows it to absorb heat from its vicinity and to create a little pocket around the user which prevents the flames from damaging the body.
		
A dangerous effect of this artefact is the fact that it will increase electrical conductivity, so the probability of electrocution while wearing this artefact is much higher, especially during storms and in the vicinity of electrical anomalies.It is quite heavy due to high density of crystal-like material.
		
 
Radiation output is high on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_blood_descr:
A reddish formation of compressed fossilised plants, soil and animal debris. Can partially neutralise chemical poisons by absorbing them and reducing overall toxicity level in user's bloodstream. Quite widespread and not very effective as it makes chemical burns fester. It will catch fire when exposed to open flame or even spontaneously combust. 
		
Another positive effect possessed by this artefact is that it accelerates clotting if worn close to the body. Although it is not recommended to keep this artefact in your possession for longer periods of time as blood clots can be hazardous to your health.
		
 
Radiation output is low on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_mincer_meat_descr:
This artefact has soft, porous, skin-like texture and is said to be able to compress. It resembles and acts like a sponge in this regard, but reveals its special characteristics only when exposed to certain external conditions.
		
Firstly, to carry the sponge metaphor further, the pores on its surface are known to absorb small amounts of toxicity from environment.
		
Secondly, the artefact slightly amplifies the damaging effects of psy-fields to living organisms by absorbing psy energy and emitting it at a small rate.
		
Thirdly, Meat Chunk is also known to be a conductor of electricity much like the skin of a living creature.
		
 
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_bracelet_descr:
Bracelet is formed from common species of bryophytes plants under high exposure to radioactive and chemical anomalies, which explains its organic nature.
		
It provides substantial protection against all types of acids by gradually increasing their pH to the level of water (pH of 7).
		
When worn, the artefact is also known to slightly counter the harmful effects of psy-anomalies or psy-waves of some mutants.
		
 
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_baloon_descr:
A compound of several hollow organic formations, this artefact emits a gaseous substance that can neutralise chemical or toxic particles inside the body without harming it. Thus providing a a great level of toxic and chemical protection.
		
It also has a constant temperature regardless of its surroundings. This allows it to absorb heat from its vicinity and to create a little pocket around the user which prevents the flames from damaging the body. 
		
Apart from that Bubble, however, possesses numerous negative properties. For example, it greatly amplifies the effects of psy-waves as well as fields produced by mutants and anomalies. This disadvantage is not to be taken lightly: some stalkers have reported that psy influence was so potent when in possession of a Bubble that they felt their heads cracking from the inside and the only thing they could do was scream in pain and run as far as they could. 
		
 
Radiation output is high on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_electra_sparkler_descr:
This artefact has the appearance of translucent spider webs. Just as proteinaceous spider silk, it is sticky and has properties of glue.
		
It can be found most commonly in or near electro anomalies and it seems to have absorbed their certain characteristics: it is able to smooth fluctuations in electric field density and acts as a weak resistor, protecting the wearer from electricity and reducing its damaging effects.
		
On the other hand, it should be noted that the presence of this artefact increases the corrosiveness of acids, leading to accelerated deterioration of equipment and higher damage to tissues of any living organism.
		
 
Radiation output is low on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_sponge_descr:
Sponge has always been under debate among the Ecologists. Some suggest that this artefact is driven from basic form of organisms, while others believe its an advanced life form with self-awareness inherited from living creatures.
		
Despite the theories surrounding the artefact, all can agree on one thing: it moves. The sponge sometimes tries to "grab" an object it touches. Putting it in a container might be a hard task, as if it wants to escape.
		
This artefact acts as a powerful resistor and will absorb even lethal doses of electricity. On the other hand, it will catch fire when exposed to open flame or even spontaneously combust.
		
 
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_ring_descr:
A very small artefact of electric nature. Difficult to spot. Consists of two ring-shaped materials of organic nature, hence the given name.
		When the Ring spins, it never stops spinning, defying the first law of thermodynamics. Scientists suggest that this artefact inherits gravitational properties from Vortex anomalies.
		
The outer ring has a high-conductivity. It absorbs electrical current from relative sources then ground it in the inner ring. Despite the basic function, the mechanism behind the disappearance of electrical power inside the second ring is still unknown.
		
On the other side, the Ring is flammable. Prolonged exposure may enhance its flammability and cause it to ignite.
		
 
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_electra_flash_descr:
This artefact is very similar in appearance to Moonlight and resembles a plasma globe or a plasma lamp.
		
Being a powerful resistor, it is well known for its ability to shield its user from lethal doses of electricity.
		
When worn, it is known to slightly counter harmful effects of psy-anomalies or psy-waves of certain mutants. Flash acts as a powerful resistor and will absorb even lethal doses of electricity.
		
However, it also hinders healing process, thus caution is advised especially when wounded or bleeding. This artefact is also extremely light and very portable.
		
 
Radiation output is high on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_cristall_flower_descr:
This artefact resembles melted cheese interspersed with sapphire-like stones. Only yellow outer shell of the artefact appears to give off radiation and by careful processing it is possible to extract the non-radioactive blue parts for jewellery and other industrial purposes. This is due to the fact that if cleaned properly and polished, sapphire comparison becomes much more explicit: the stones are as hard and durable as this beautiful gem. This quality of theirs and their appearance make them perfect gemstones and jewellers all over the world strive to have them in stock. 
		
The usefulness of the artefact, however, is not limited to its industrial applications. There is scientific evidence suggesting that sapphire-like stones effectively protect from psy-waves, whereas the outer shell slightly increases resistance to toxicity.
		
However, it can cause objects in its vicinity to heat up and in extreme cases to ignite along with the artefact. For this reason, it is safe to conclude that it absorbs heat and is able to convey it to other objects.
		
Due to its density the weight of artefact has increased beyond normal standards, and thus it is one of the heaviest anomalous creations in the Zone.
		
 
Radiation output is low on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_lobster_eyes_descr:
As the name suggests, this artefact has the shape of two eggs fused together. The outer surface is very thick, the high density of its formation might be the reason behind its deep colour.
		
This artefact offers slightly more psy-protection than its cousin, Stone Flower. It resonates under the influence of psy-waves to some degree and absorbs the dangerous effect.
		
Another positive property is the ability to consume excessive heat while remaining cool at all times.
		
Due to its density of the surface, the Lobster Eyes is quite heavy.
		
 
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_electra_moonlight_descr:
This unique electrostatic artefact can resonate under the influence of psy-waves. Stalkers have learned to fine-tune the artefact so that it resonates in opposite phase to the main source of emissions, thus significantly neutralizing their effects. This orb of considerable beauty also increases electrical protection by reducing conductivity in the body when exposed to high levels of electricity.
		
It should be noted that Moonlight will catch fire when exposed to open flame or even spontaneously combust. 
		
 
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_black_spray_descr:
Being a rare artefact, little is known about its properties and origins. 
		
Black Spray shares a similar shape to other sapphire-like artefacts. However, the organic nature of the stem (which shares similar properties to Pin artefacts) suggests that its formed from vascular plants under exposure to dangerous psy-fields and electromagnetic waves.
		
Another unique property is the ability to delay the transmission of light that enters it. The said mysterious mechanism is applied to psy-waves surrounding the artefact as well. For this particular reason, Black Spray significantly neutralises psy interferences in a large radius.
		
These beneficial properties, however, come at a price. This artefact is extremely dangerous when exposed in toxic environments as it amplifies their effect and increases their potency. When exploring toxic areas, it is hence highly recommended to keep the artefact in your backpack.
		
Due to the beautiful blue aura it emits, it is highly sought after by jewellers all over the world.
		
 
Radiation output is high on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_medusa_descr:
Very common in the Zone. This gravitational artefact is able to slightly shield the body and objects from physical impacts.
		
It will slightly protect its user against extreme heat produced respectively by fire anomalies.
		
This artefact is quite heavy as the gravitational field seems to increase mass. Another downside to this artefact is that it will increase the negative effects of psy-waves and is a potent conductor.
		
 
Radiation output is low on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_vyvert_descr:
This bizarrely-shaped artefact appears in places with increased gravitational activity.
		
Although it appears almost organic, it is actually more similar to coral. Due to its gravitational nature, It provides protection against physical impacts as it greatly reduces the friction caused by fast objects.
		
Acting as a kind of sponge that absorbs chemical and toxic elements as well, this artefact provides protection from external toxic agents as well as from chemical particles that have already made their way into the body.
		
Wrenced can generate a locally directed gravity field which increases its mass. For this reason, this artefact is heavy.
		
 
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_empty_descr:
Two disks of organic formation (commonly lipids, cellulose and lignin) with nothing but empty space in between. This is due to a unique gravitation field formed in the centre that stabilise the distance between the disks.
		
Any attempt to press the disks together, or pull them apart will fail due to rapid positive/negative changes in the gravitational field. As if the artefact reacts to any physical power that breaks its balance.
		
Because of this mechanism, moving with an Empty is a hard task. As the gravitational field increases the density of surrounding air and slows the body down.
		
The real usefulness of this effect comes to the ability to reduce friction, thus obtaining great protection against physical impacts.
		
 
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_full_empty_descr:
Similar to Empty, this artefact consist of two disks of organic formation connected by a unique gravitational field in between. However, the said field in Full Empty is extraordinary: all atoms entering the centre, regardless of their nature, become interactive under the unknown effects of the field. Thus releasing photons (light emitting).
		
Scientists usually refer to it as the "galaxy effect", which gives the artefact an exceptional orbit of light.
		
The density increment of surrounding air caused by moving is higher comparing to Empty. Because of this, the artefact will greatly hinder its holder's movement.
		
Being superior artefact to Empty, the protection against physical impacts is remarkable. Some claims that Full Empty is capable of stopping 9mm bullets fired at point blank.
		
 
Radiation output is high on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_night_star_descr:
This glowing artefact can generate a local directed low-gravity field. Widely used by stalkers along with Gravi, a similar artefact, to increase maximum load.
		
Due to its beautiful inner core it is highly sought after by jewellers all over the world, however it is best to proceed with caution as unskilled treatment can cause the artefact to explode with power sufficient to level a small building. It is thus highly advised to perform the polishing by means of specialised machinery, which minimises the probability of explosion. Moreover, only the outer core of the artefact emits radiation.
		
Nightstar will also absorb toxic and chemical agents from the environment, which makes it a valuable artefact for artefact hunters, although the amount of toxicity absorbed is negligible. It is, however, relatively cheap and even stalkers with pretty tight budgets can afford it if opportunity to buy it arises. 
		
That being said, Nightstar emits odour of burning flesh when in the closest proximity of heat source. Prolonged exposure may enhance its flammability and cause it to ignite.
		
 
Radiation output is low on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_gravi_descr:
Gravi is formed from metallic substances exposed to prolonged gravitation. This makes it capable of sustaining an powerful anti-gravitational field, which causes it to have various properties, among others reducing weight of all objects in its close proximity. For a long time, the artefact was a mystery, and it was scientist Sakharov at Yantar who first discovered that Gravi creates a minute singularity field of anti-gravitational nature, the phenomenon which occurs in intervals of 30 minutes.
		
A dangerous effect of this artefact is the fact that it will increase electrical conductivity, so the probability of electrocution while wearing this artefact is much higher, especially during storms and in the vicinity of electrical anomalies.
		
Another downside is that it will increase the negative effects of psy-waves and is a potent conductor.
		
 
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_gold_fish_descr:
Direct successor to and a superior version of Gravi artefact. As was the case with Gravi, it was scientist Sakharov at Yantar who discovered its unique properties after a massive blowout/emission hit the Zone.
		
Thanks to meticulous research that followed, it was established that this new artefact is produced when three Gravi artefacts interact and get sucked into one another's singularity fields. This phenomenon is extremely rare, due to which the artefact is highly valued.
		
It is rumoured within Ukrainian Spetsnaz circles that in the Zone there are agents from the Ministry of Defence of the Russian Federation whose sole objective is acquiring and transporting Goldfish to specialised laboratories located outside of the Zone.
		
The artefact creates a constant anti-gravitational singularity field which affects only its closest vicinity. However, some stalkers have been known to disappear for no apparent reason leaving only a Goldfish behind.
		
Big downside, however, comes along with this powerful anti-gravitational field: the velocity of moving objects inside its radius will rapidly increase, causing dangerous impacts on surrounding objects, including the holder.
		
 
Radiation output is highest on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_dummy_glassbeads_descr:
Shaped like a DNA helix, Mama's Beads are created in the Burner anomaly. One of their most characteristic features is that they constantly pulsate, generating emissions beneficial to the human body. These emissions increase the metabolism of any living creature, accelerating coagulation and healing of wounds.The mechanism behind the effects of this artefact is still unknown.
		
Mama's Beads also possess potent protective qualities: they are able to shield the body and objects from extreme heat.
		
On the other hand, it should be noted that the presence of this artefact increases electrical conductivity, so the probability of electrocution while wearing this artefact is much higher, especially during storms and in the vicinity of electrical anomalies.
		
The weight is also quite high for such a small artefact, which leads to a conclusion that is of high density.
		
 
Radiation output is low on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_eye_descr:
This artefact, which resembles the human eye, considerably increases metabolism of the body, helping wounds heal quicker. Experienced stalkers say that Eye also brings luck. Irrespective of the validity of that statement, its positive effects are indeed quite potent. 
		
This artefact soothes the pain and is extremely useful when treating wounds.
		
When worn, it is known to slightly counter harmful effects of psy-anomalies or psy-waves of certain mutants.
		
These beneficial qualities, however, come at a price. This artefact is extremely dangerous when exposed to chemical anomalies as it amplifies their toxicity and increases their potency. It is hence highly recommended to keep the artefact in your backpack, never on the body, when exploring toxic areas unless you have a death wish.
		
The artefact is also known colloquially as "copper eye" as it conducts electricity and amplifies its dangerous effects in the same way as copper does. 
		
 
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_fire_descr:
This artefact forms in areas of high thermal activity. Produces powerful infrared emissions which intensify metabolic processes, healing wounds before its bearer's very eyes.
		
Its healing capabilities are even stronger than in case of the Eye as stalkers in possession of this artefact are said to have survived being wounded by chimeras. Thanks to that, it has earned the reputation of a miraculous artefact.
		
Many stalkers owe it their lives, and most veteran mutant hunters carry it in case they run into danger. However, it shares not only positive but also negative properties of its cousin: entering a psy-field with this artefact on the belt is suicide. It will absorb psy energy and emitting it at a considerable rate.
		
Also, it is highly advised to proceed with caution when planning to bring the artefact to the market as prolonged exposure to even minimal amounts of radioactive materials can result in death of the user.
		
It can also be used as a reusable medkit of sorts since it heals wounds very quickly.
		
 
Radiation output is high on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_dummy_battery_descr:
The artefact is quite popular in the Zone and is valued by its residents and visitors alike for its energizing properties, although it has an adverse effect on the body when used for prolonged periods of time.
		
One should take note, however, that this artefact hinders blood clotting and increases bleeding rate of open wounds. On the other hand, being a powerful resistor, it is well known for its ability to shield its user from lethal doses of electricity.
		
Being an artefact of electric nature, it is well known for its ability to shield its user from lethal doses of electricity. On the contrary, it should be noted that Battery absorbs heat and is able to convey it to other objects.
		
This artefact is also extremely light and very portable. 
		
 
Radiation output is low on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_dummy_dummy_descr:
Shell is composed of two disk of bluish colour connected by semitransparent material of unknown nature.
		
This strange artefact was considered devoid of any useful properties by many scientists for a long time. Only recently has it been discovered that it is indeed quite beneficial.
		
When the artefact comes into contact with the body, it will make one feel rejuvenated and thus it increases stamina recovery. This effect has in case of some stalkers induced hyperactivity. One downside of this artefact, however, is that it reduces the number of platelets in blood, thus increasing bleeding rate.
		
It provides a considerable level of psy protection and absorbs electromagnetic interference, acting as a grounding material.
		
It will catch fire when exposed to open flame or even spontaneously combust. Caution must be taken when approaching heat sources with this artefact.
		
Shell is extremely light and very portable.
		
 
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_ice_descr:
Also colloquially known as "Radioactive Snowflake". At first glance, this artefact resembles a white Kolobok.
		
Thanks to its unique properties, the artefact can significantly increase the bearer's muscle tone, thus greatly improving stamina recovery. Due to its high radioactivity, stalkers in possession of it are sometimes jokingly referred to as "Radioactive Snowflakes".
		
When faced with the decision whether to carry it on the belt during a mission, you have to carefully weigh its pros and cons: does it pay to have greater endurance and high protection against electricity at the cost of being constantly exposed to its deadly radiation? Even if you are determined to take it with you, it should be noted that it is not to be used on long excursions to the Zone.
		
Snowflake, however, holds a big downside: it interacts with surrounding energy sources by absorbing and amplifying their effects. For this reason, approaching heat sources, toxic areas and psy-fields while holding this artefact is a suicide.
		
It is as light as a snowflake and very easy to carry around.
		
 
Radiation output is high on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_soul_descr:
Soul is a unique organic artefact with properties just as unique: it secretes slimy goo that dramatically increases recovery rate of wounds. Thanks to its reasonable price and attractive appearance, this artefact is a valuable collector's item.
		
Applying its gooey substance to wounds will soothes the pain and speeds up healing process. 
		\It also reduces the effects of psy-waves and their damage to one's brain. But it should be known that Soul drains power from its user. The artefact does not have high density and thus is not very heavy.
		
 
Radiation output is low on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_fuzz_kolobok_descr:
A relatively rare artefact forming in chemical areas, Kolobok is highly valued for its ability to heal most kinds of wounds and stop bleeding in a matter of minutes.
		
For unknown reasons, scientists are spreading rumours among stalkers that the artefact modifies bearer's genetic code, which is unproven and should be regarded as conscious attempt at monopolizing the supply of the artefact by the scientific community. This does not, however, mean that it is completely harmless.
		
One drawback of this artefact is the fact that it will interact to radioactive particles, so it is best to avoid radiation fields when in possession of the artefact, especially since its negative effects are not balanced with positive ones. It will also reduce energy recovery, which is the result of its sharp needle-like appendages. The needles cause small and quickly healing wounds which bring constant pain and itch, thus reducing stamina.
		
This artefact also weakens protection against heat and acids due to its high flammability. 
		
Lightweight and not too much of a burden to carry around.
		
Radiation output is average on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_glass_descr:
Firefly interacts with fields unknown to science, considerably speeding up regeneration of tissue and organs in living beings, as well as normalizing metabolic processes.
		
This artefact can literally get a badly wounded stalker back on his feet in a matter of minutes. On the other hand, Firefly can spontaneously combust when exposed to potent radioactive sources.
		
A big downside to this artefact is that it weakens the body and reduce the number of platelets in blood during heal process, thus increasing bleeding rate.
		
It seems to drain stamina and decrease stamina recovery greatly as well. Some of those who used Firefly for its healing purposes have reported that they couldn't walk for hours afterwards.
		
Unfortunately, Firefly is extremely rare.
		
Radiation output is high on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_compass_descr:
A very rare artefact. It's been several years since one was found.
		
It can locate gaps in anomaly fields. It is believed that it can help one traverse the most complex anomaly fields completely unharmed. However, very few know how to handle it properly.
		
The Compass showed few unique properties under last experiments. It can interact to moving objects, causing some to completely disappear. Or perhaps teleport?
		
It also weakens the body by draining stamina and increasing bleeding rate constantly. But the biggest draw however, is the dangerous radiation output this artefact emits comparing to the artefact radiation scale.
		
Holding this artefact near the body will cause death in matter of few minutes.
st_af_oasis_heart_descr:
This artefact was found at the centre of the legendary Oasis. It appears that the Heart is a crystallised plant, which has acquired the healing properties of the Oasis.
		
Not only it dramatically increases recovery rate of wounds and healing process, but also provides the body with strong source of energy. It is a true miracle.
		
That being said, the Oasis is very sensitive to outer sources of energy and surrounding environment. For this reason, interacting with anomaly fields will bring death to the holder.
		
 
Radiation output is highest on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_death_lamp_descr:
"Big, red and cursed."
		
This is how the locals prefer to describe the Death Lamp, while some refer to it as the "Seed of Satan". Many traders believe the rumours surrounding the artefact, thus refusing to buy it.
		Little is known about its origins, and nothing of value has been discovered so far.
		
Death Lamp was first discovered few years ago by a group of three experienced stalkers. Shortly after delivering the artefact to the Ecologists in Yantar, two of them found dead with a horrific expression on their faces. Nothing is known about the fate of the third stalker.
		
Following the accident, members of the science team who studied the artefact had reported having nightmare disorder in the days to follow.
		
Apart from the mysterious effects, the artefact drains vitality and willpower from the user, often on such a scale that it induces dizziness and in extreme cases causes the user to faint. 
		
 
Radiation output is highest on the artefact radiation scale.
st_af_monolith_descr:
The origins of artefacts such as this one are a mystery, as they are rarely found outside the northernmost parts of the Zone.
		
This unique artefact projects a non-contact field that inhibits nearbly anomalous phenomena. This grants the wearer a notable level of protection against most of the Zone's environmental hazards. It is also one of the few active artefacts that can be safely handled without lead containers.
		However, when you hold it your flesh feels dry and flaky, your bones hard and stiff, the ligaments in your joints squeaky and brittle. Thick armour or great supernatural vitality would be needed by anyone intending to wear this artefact into battle.
st_af_black_descr: Truly, an amazing thing. The Black Stone protects against broadly considered adversity but instead is slowly killing the owner. Some stalkers suspect the artefact is a shard of the Monolith.
st_af_misery_bread_descr:
A piece of bread as dark as the soul of the person that left it.
 
%c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:
%c[ui_white] • %c[ui_gray_2] artefact
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] attachable
st_af_cocoon_descr:
A formation of gravitational nature. A useless trinket, yet is highly valued by collectors and jewellers. Not radioactive.
 

		%c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:

		%c[ui_white] • %c[ui_gray_2] junk

		%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] can not be placed in a container
st_af_cell_descr:
An artefact of gravitational nature. A useless trinket, yet is highly valued by collectors and jewellers. Not radioactive.
 

		%c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:

		%c[ui_white] • %c[ui_gray_2] junk

		%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] can not be placed in a container
st_af_fountain_descr:
An anomaly of presumably gravitational nature. It does not have any useful properties, but because of it's bizarre shape it is very valued by collectors. Not radioactive.
 

		%c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:

		%c[ui_white] • %c[ui_gray_2] junk

		%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] can not be placed in a container
st_af_spaika_descr:
Looks much like a petrified formation. Is an anomaly of presumably gravitational nature. Has no useful properties, Not radioactive.
 

		%c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:

		%c[ui_white] • %c[ui_gray_2] junk

		%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] can not be placed in a container
st_af_signet_descr:
Some stalkers call this artefact the "Amulet". Quite useless, yet some stalkers believe that this artefact brings good luck. Not radioactive.
 

		%c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:

		%c[ui_white] • %c[ui_gray_2] junk

		%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] can not be placed in a container
st_af_repei_descr:
It is quite often spawned by anomalies of a gravitational nature. It has no valuable properties, but the absence of any harmful effects on the body makes it a must-have for many stalkers. Light, and very valued by jewellers and collectors. Not radioactive.
 

		%c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:

		%c[ui_white] • %c[ui_gray_2] junk

		%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] can not be placed in a container
st_af_bat_descr:
A very beautiful abnormal formation. Has no useful properties, Not radioactive and quite heavy. Valued by collectors.
 

		%c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:

		%c[ui_white] • %c[ui_gray_2] junk

		%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] can not be placed in a container
st_af_sun_descr:
A rare specimen that is very much appreciated by collectors. Has no useful properties, but it is an inexhaustible source of light, very heavy. Not radioactive.
 

		%c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:

		%c[ui_white] • %c[ui_gray_2] junk

		%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] can not be placed in a container
st_af_ear_descr:
Artefact with a bizarre shape. Its core resembles a human body. Has no useful properties, Not radioactive. Valuable to collectors outside of the Zone.
 

		%c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:

		%c[ui_white] • %c[ui_gray_2] junk

		%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] can not be placed in a container
st_af_chelust_descr:
A very strange artefact. Generates a strong gravitational field while nothing touches it. Has no useful properties, very heavy. Valuable to collectors outside of the Zone.
 

		%c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:

		%c[ui_white] • %c[ui_gray_2] junk

		%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] can not be placed in a container
st_af_atom_descr:

st_arty_save_descr:
One of the most mysterious artefacts in the Zone, the Eye of the Noosphere can transport its wielder back in time, even to escape death. A tight squeeze of the artefact activates its ability, creating a restoration point to go back to on activation or death. Frequent use can cause the artefact to change colour, but if discharged too frequently it may cease to function altogether. The Eye gradually restores its power over time, supposedly being fuelled by the anomalous energy of the Zone.
 

		%c[ui_gray_2]PROPERTIES:

		%c[ui_white] • %c[0,255,215,0] superartefact
ui_st_take_all_hint: Move all items to your backpack (SHIFT + T)
not_enough_money_partner: The character does not have enough money
st_no_trade_tip_1: The trader isn’t interested in items like this.
st_no_trade_tip_2: The item is too damaged to be traded.
st_ui_main_sensor:
TOOLTIP UNAVAILABLE! Ionising radiation poisoning
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Exposure to ionising radiation poses an extreme, perhaps even fatal, risk. For this reason, the ability to adequately measure radiation levels is a vital skill. The basic unit in the scale of ionising radiation is millisievert %c[ui_gray_3](mSv)%c[ui_gray_1]. Levels of approximately %c[ui_gray_3]8000 mSv %c[ui_gray_1]are usually lethal without a chance of recovery. Radiation levels above the threshold of 1000 mSv (see below) can be briefly endured, but are highly problematic if left untreated. In case of exposure, it is thus strongly advised to administer anti-radiation drugs of appropriate potency as soon as possible. Table 3.2 presents radiation levels with typical symptoms:
 
%c[0,102,255,0]250 - 1500 mSv: %c[ui_gray_2]Symptoms are unnoticeable. Long term consequences are negligible.
 
%c[0,255,255,0]1500 - 3000 mSv: %c[ui_gray_2]Noticeable moderate to strong sickness, light-headedness, skin stains. Long-term symptoms are mild. Full recovery is possible if treated promptly.
 
%c[0,255,122,0]3000 - 4500 mSv: %c[ui_gray_2]Very strong sickness, confusion and dizziness leading to premature death if not treated in relatively short time. Complete cease of hunger and thirst, taint, diarrhoea, peeling of skin and hair loss. High risk of permanent loss of reproduction ability. Restoration of bodily functions is feasible with extensive use of cleansing agents.
 
%c[d_red]4500 - 6000 mSv: %c[ui_gray_2]Intensification of the above symptoms. Additionally, permanent damage to central nervous system. Death highly probable.
 
%c[d_red]6000 mSv and above: %c[ui_gray_2]Imminent death. Often after rapid loss of consciousness.
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] unit: %c[ui_gray_1]mSv (milisivert)
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] imminent lethal radiation: %c[ui_gray_1]~6000+ mSv
%c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] av. outside rad. hot-spots potency: %c[ui_gray_1]~900 mSv / min
ui_inv_burn_protection:
Burn Resistance
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Burn Resistance is primarily a measure of your ability to withstand thermal anomalies, as well as survive encounters with pyrokinetic mutants. Thermal anomalies come in several forms: they can manifest as a hemisphere of thermal radiation, slowly cooking anything that steps into them. They can manifest as shimmering waves of air that erupt into powerful jets of flame, and they can even manifest as mobile comets. It is not unusual for two or more of these variants to manifest together: for instance, the bridge tunnel leading to Yantar from Wild Territory consists of both the comet and eruption variants.
 
The eruption variant, colloquially known as a "Burner", is several hundred degrees Celsius, and some forms are powerful enough to instantly roast their hapless victims, regardless of their protection. In the north of the Zone, a Burner variant known as the "Boiler" operates on the same principles, but utilizes superheated gushes of steam instead of flame.
 
It is rumoured that thermal anomalies give birth to some of the more powerful artefacts of the Zone, but the dangers are so great, even with proper protection, that most choose to steer clear of them.
 
%c[d_orange]How Much Protection Do You Need?
%c[ui_gray_1]Important: The percentage values suggested below refer only to how full the Burn Resistance bar appears, which is determined predominantly by armour. This should not be confused with any percentages shown on belt items or consumables, which do not stack additively.
 
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Due to the rarity of pyrokinetic mutants, as well as most stalkers' predisposition to not being roasted alive, the average stalker doesn't bother much with Burn Resistance, choosing to steer clear of thermal anomalies entirely, and might incidentally obtain 15% Burn Resistance when they can afford their first decent suit. 
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Commissioned military stalkers, who need to be able to operate in the harshest conditions, typically have at least 40% Burn Resistance, which has let them flank more than a few surprised enemies by approaching them through thermal anomalies.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Independent, full-time artefact hunters and field researchers struggle to afford suit maintenance for the kind of damage that thermal anomalies can do, and as such avoid them the same way most stalkers would unless fulfilling a special contract.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Accomplished government scientists, however, do not need to worry much about cost, and elect to wear suits with 75% Burn Resistance so that they can operate with relative safety.
ui_inv_chemical_burn_protection:
Chemical Resistance
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Chemical Resistance is a measure of your armour's ability to withstand toxic, acidic or corrosive materials. In the Zone, these materials are most often found in the form of chemical anomalies, the most common of which being the infamous "Burnt Fuzz", a moss or vine-like entity that releases thousands of sharp, toxic spores at the hapless stalker who runs into it. Other forms of chemical anomalies include gas clouds that cover entire areas, slime puddles that rot whatever steps in them, or even miniature acidic fog banks that react explosively to metal or organic matter.
 
All of these excel at eating exposed skin or devouring exposed respiratory systems. Nonetheless, these anomalies are among the first a junior artefact hunter will investigate, as it is relatively cheap to acquire decent armour and medication for resisting their effects.
 
%c[d_orange]How Much Protection Do You Need?
%c[ui_gray_1]Important: The percentage values suggested below refer only to how full the Chemical Resistance bar appears, which is determined predominantly by armour. This should not be confused with any percentages shown on belt items or consumables, which do not stack additively.
 
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] The average stalker will easily achieve at least 30% Chemical Resistance as soon as they can afford their first full-face gas mask and stalker suit, and many find this to be more than enough. If planning to hunt artefacts, they'll usually supplement this protection with appropriate medication.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Commissioned military stalkers, who need to be able to operate in the harshest conditions, typically have at least 45% Chemical Resistance, allowing them to hide in gas clouds for a limited time if need be.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Independent, full-time artefact hunters and field researchers agree that 45% Chemical Resistance is sufficient for most cases.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Government scientists, however, spare no expense, and will typically opt for 55% Chemical Resistance during their field experiments and investigations.
ui_inv_fire_wound_protection:
Ballistic Resistance
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Ballistic resistance, as one might expect, indicates the anti-ballistic properties of your body armour. It's a measure of your armour's ability to safely absorb the kinetic energy of small, high-velocity objects such as bullets or shrapnel. Ideally, this would mean the bullet doesn't get through your armour at all, but sadly this isn't a perfect world, and particularly heavy rounds can still cause bleeding even if they don't manage to outright penetrate. Equipping multiple kevlar, titanium or steel plates can significantly improve Ballistic Resistance, almost regardless of what you're wearing.
 
%c[d_orange]How Much Protection Do You Need?
%c[ui_gray_1]Important: The percentage values suggested below refer only to how full the Ballistic Resistance bar appears, which is determined predominantly by armour. This should not be confused with any percentages shown on belt items or consumables, which do not stack additively.
 
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] The average stalker knows better than to go looking for a fight, and as such can get by on 10% Ballistic Resistance.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Professional mercenaries, scouts or hitmen will want 15% Ballistic Resistance at a minimum, and will aim for better as soon as they can afford it.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Spetsnaz operators, who are often expected to disperse small stalker camps and conduct surgical strikes against entrenched positions, will accept no less than 40% Ballistic Resistance.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Commissioned military stalkers, who are expected to break meatgrinders and turn the tide of the most vicious firefights, go into battle with a minimum of 60% Ballistic Resistance.
ui_inv_radiation_protection:
Radiation Resistance
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Most radiation in the Zone travels via solid alpha particles, commonly inhaled via dust or moisture. The degree to which you are irradiated by these particles is measured in milisieverts, or mSv. You can check your mSv levels at any time, provided you own a Geiger counter.
 
Radiation Resistance measures your suit or mask's ability to filter the air around you, reducing the rate at which you acquire mSv from irradiated areas. However, Radiation Resistance is preventative, not reductive: it does not reduce the damage done by radiation already accrued. If you decide to run naked through the Nuclear Power Plant and acquire 3000 mSv as a result, putting on a gas mask won't do much to save you at that point. Radiation Resistance also does not reduce the radiation accrued through ingesting Zone meats, nor do they block the radiation emitted by artefacts.
 
%c[ui_gray_1]In these cases, you'll need to rely on medicine or other consumables to flush your system instead. In the Zone, your system naturally flushes 1 mSv every 4-6 seconds.
 
%c[0,250,250,250,0]Degrees of Irradiation
 
%c[0,250,250,250,0] •%c[ui_gray_1] At 20 mSv, you may begin to experience headaches, but should otherwise be alright.
%c[0,250,250,250,0] •%c[ui_gray_1] At 100-900 mSv, your health will begin to deteriorate at a rate of less than 1.5% of your maximum every 4-6 seconds. Depending on severity, this could mean you'll be okay no matter what, or it could mean you have hours to live without treatment.
%c[0,250,250,0,0] •%c[ui_gray_1] At approximately 950-1900 mSv, you'll experience blurred vision, hot flashes, and a health deterioration of less than 5% every 4-6 seconds. Without any means of flushing your system faster, this could mean you have minutes to live.
%c[d_orange] •%c[ui_gray_1] At 1950 mSv, the deterioration becomes more serious. 
%c[d_red] •%c[ui_gray_1] At 2900 mSv, your condition is critical, and you'll lose health at a rate of 7% or higher every 4-6 seconds. This means less than a minute and a half to live, at best.
 
%c[d_orange]How Much Protection Do You Need?
 
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] The average stalker will aim for 40% Radiation Resistance as soon as they can afford it.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Commissioned military stalkers aim for 65% Radiation Resistance, so that even if their masks are damaged they can still enjoy safety from radioactive particles.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Independent, full-time artefact hunters and field researchers find that 58% Radiation Resistance is enough for most practical scientific purposes.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Government scientists, however, also err on the side of caution with 65% Radiation Resistance.
ui_inv_shock_protection:
Electrical Resistance
 
%c[ui_gray_1]While the greater scientific community sees Electro anomalies as a potential source for renewable power, to you these electrical manifestations are unstable and deadly oscillations of energy that must be handled with care.
 
%c[ui_gray_1]To this end, Electrical Resistance measures how well your armour insulates you from electric shock. Electrical anomalies can manifest either as "pools" of electricity on the ground, or as "Tesla" comets floating about in a rhythmic fashion.
 
%c[d_orange]How Much Protection Do You Need?
%c[ui_gray_1]Important: The percentage values suggested below refer only to how full the Electrical Resistance bar appears, which is determined predominantly by armour. This should not be confused with any percentages shown on belt items or consumables, which do not stack additively.
 
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Electro anomalies vary in strength, but the average stalker finds that 20% Electrical Resistance is enough to help them survive the occasional accident.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Commissioned military stalkers, who must be reasonably ready for absolutely anything, prefer having at least 40% Electrical Resistance, as they know how strong such anomalies can be in the most dangerous parts of the Zone.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Independent, full-time artefact hunters and field researchers agree that 40-45% Electrical Resistance is sufficient protection in most cases.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Government scientists, however, will spring for at least 70% Electrical Resistance whenever they can.
ui_inv_telepatic_protection:
Psychic Resistance
 
%c[ui_gray_1]The Zone is a complex maze, full of deadly and unusual traps, and nowhere is this better illustrated than within the deadly psy-anomaly. The most infamous sources of psychic phenomena include the Brain Scorcher, Miracle Machine, Emissions and Psy-Storms, which are too powerful to be resisted outside of the most esoteric or specialized gear.
 
Thus, Psychic Resistance is mostly a measure of how well you can withstand the telepathic assaults of psy-mutants, or how long you can stay in lesser psy-anomalies.
 
Psychic damage is unusual in that it does not harm you physically, but rather saps your self-control or will to live (if you're looking for your will to live, it's just above the health bar). Overexposure to psy-waves inevitably leads to memory loss, suicide or even zombification, and recovery from psy-waves requires specialized meds or artefacts: regular medkits do nothing to heal a fractured mind, but scientific medkits are markedly more successful.
 
Psychic fields generally spherical or hemispherical, and are more potent the closer you are to its centre.
 
%c[d_orange]How Much Protection Do You Need?
%c[ui_gray_1]Important: The percentage values suggested below refer only to how full the Psychic Resistance bar appears, which is determined predominantly by armour. This should not be confused with any percentages shown on belt items or consumables, which do not stack additively.
 
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] The average stalker rarely encounters psy-mutants, or might not even believe they exist. Most aim for no more than 5% Psychic Resistance, although wiser stalkers are sure to carry psy-block, alprazolam or marijuana for emergencies.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Commissioned military stalkers, who must be ready for absolutely anything, will aim for at least 30% Psychic Resistance. Some of them are all too familiar with what can happen if a Controller gets unrestrained access to your mind. 
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Independent, full-time artefact hunters or field researchers will aim for at least 50% Psychic Resistance, allowing them to spend time in more potent psy-anomalies.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Government scientists will go the extra mile, and aim for 55% Psychic Resistance so that they can push that little bit deeper.
ui_inv_wound_protection:
Rupture Resistance
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Rupture resistance represents your armour's ability to absorb and displace the trauma imparted by all sorts of physical blows and impacts. These include - but are not limited to - attempted punches, kicks, stabs, cuts, bites and telekinetically thrown debris. 
 
%c[ui_gray_1]This aspect of your armour not only reduces the initial damage caused by such attacks, but also reduces the degree of bleeding any single strike can give you.
 
Rupture resistance also synergise with your ballistic resistance. This is because even bullets that do not penetrate your ballistic armour can still cause blunt trauma, which rupture resistance reduces.
 
%c[d_orange]How Much Protection Do You Need?
%c[ui_gray_1]Important: The percentage values suggested below refer only to how full the Rupture Resistance bar appears, which is determined predominantly by armour. This should not be confused with any percentages shown on belt items or consumables, which do not stack additively.
 
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Knowing that mutants cannot be reasoned with, the average stalker will aim for a minimum of 15% Rupture Resistance as soon as they can afford it.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] A professional mercenary will also aim for 15% Rupture Resistance as a minimum, and will obtain better when their budget allows.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Spetsnaz operators, who are expected to clear out mutant lairs or assist in lab raids, do not settle for less than 40% Rupture Resistance.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Commissioned military Stalkers, who are expected to survive alone for long periods in the most dangerous parts of the Zone, surprisingly settle for as little as 25% Rupture Resistance, but will exceed their Spetsnaz brethren when the mission requires.
ui_inv_power_restore:
Stamina Recovery
 
%c[ui_gray_1]First, let's cover some fundamentals:
 
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] You are not a pack mule, and making peace with this simple truth is the key to managing your energy.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] High stamina recovery makes it easier to sprint great distances, escape gravitational anomalies, vault over obstacle after obstacle, and even resist some paranormal phenomena, such as telekinesis.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Poor stamina recovery can make even a light walk a draining exercise. When stamina reserves dip too low, it becomes impossible to initiate a sprint. When they empty, it becomes impossible to walk. Better stamina recovery means you'll empty your reserves slower and fill them faster.
 
%c[ui_gray_1]As you don't want to be out of stamina when a live grenade rolls up next to you, or a pack of dogs decides to chase you down, it's important to keep your stamina recovery high.
 
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] The most basic way to do this is to always ensure you're well fed, rested and hydrated. These three things can already mean the difference between life and death.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Next, be mindful of your carry weight. If you're carrying more than 50% of your total weight capacity, you may notice your recovery slow slightly. This effect becomes more noticeable as you approach maximum capacity. If you're carrying above your maximum capacity, all actions that drain stamina - including walking - will begin draining it significantly faster.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Equip higher quality backpacks, or wear armours that grant more carrying capacity than they take up, to let yourself carry more equipment without impacting your stamina recovery.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Unless specially modified, most gas masks make breathing a hot and sweaty affair. When you don't need your headgear's protective qualities, take it off for a small stamina recovery boost.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Many artefacts and belt items can boost your recovery rates even further.
%c[d_cyan] •%c[ui_gray_1] Consumables that boost carry weight or recovery, such as Hercules or energy drinks, can be invaluable for escaping emergencies.
st_ui_bleeding_sensor:
TOOLTIP UNAVAILABLE! Bleeding
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Bleeding can rapidly drain your health if not treated promptly. Bleeding is most often caused by piercing or slashing attacks that manage to get through your armour and puncture your skin, although excessive blunt trauma can cause bleeding through even the sturdiest suits.
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Bandages, army medkits or tourniquets can effectively stop the bleeding, while coagulating agents such as vinca can be used to reduce the overall rate of bleeding. Note that it is generally faster and cheaper to stop your bleeding outright than it is to try regenerate your health through it. Finally, be aware that bleeding is cumulative: multiple small wounds can lead to just as much blood loss as a single severe one.
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Mild bleeding can be quickly stopped with bandages, or may even stop on its own given time.
%c[d_cyan] • %c[0,250,250,0]Moderate bleeding can deal a great amount of damage over time if left unattended, but is usually stopped quickly with proper medical attention. Some injuries heal on their own, but others simply lead to a slow death over the course of minutes.
%c[d_cyan] • %c[d_orange] Serious blood loss can lead to death in less than a minute if it isn't treated immediately. Without imminent medical attention, there is little chance of survival.
%c[d_cyan] • %c[d_red] Severe blood loss can kill in seconds, even if you're in peak physical condition. May require extensive medical supplies to treat while in the field.
st_ui_health_sensor_inv:
Health
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Your health represents your body's ability to endure physical illness and trauma. A full bar means you're in peak condition, while a nearly empty one means you're about to go into shock. From there, you're as good as dead, so tread carefully. 
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Armour, as well as some medication, can protect you from different kinds of pain, making it easier to endure. Some items, like medkits or stimpacks, alleviate pain entirely, treating your injuries and restoring your health.
 
%c[ui_gray_1]However, even the best protection is still worse than avoiding damage outright, which you can do through employing companions, cover, disguises, darkness and paying attention to your environment. In the Zone, the most direct route isn't always the safest.
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Another important factor in your survival is that you stay hydrated, well-fed and well-rested: in other words, take care of yourself. A body that is well looked-after will have a much easier time coping with pain than one that is malnourished, dessicated or passing out from exhaustion.
 
That said, life in the Zone is never without danger, and can be summed up thus: to return to the outside world with treasure is great! To do so without scars is even better! But to not return at all? That's just fate.
 
%c[0,255,255,255]Bleeding
 
%c[ui_gray_1]Bleeding occurs when piercing or slashing attacks manage to puncture your skin, although excessive blunt trauma can cause bleeding through even the sturdiest suits.
 
%c[d_cyan] • %c[0,255,255,255]Mild bleeding can be quickly stopped with bandages, or may even stop on its own given time, especially if you're under the effects of a coagulant like Vinca.
%c[d_cyan] • %c[0,250,250,0]Moderate bleeding can deal a great amount of damage over time if left unattended, but is usually stopped quickly with proper medical attention such as a tourniquet. Some moderate bleeds stop on their own, especially with Vinca, but others simply lead to a slow death over the course of minutes.
%c[d_cyan] • %c[d_orange] Serious blood loss can lead to death in less than a minute. Without imminent medical attention, ideally from an army or scientific medkit, there is little chance of survival.
%c[d_cyan] • %c[d_red] Severe blood loss can kill in seconds, even if you're in peak physical condition. May require extensive medical supplies to treat while in the field.
st_itm_desc_outfit_patch_torn: The %s on this outfit has been torn
st_itm_desc_workshop_tool: usable on mechanic's workshop for part replacement and upgrades
st_itm_desc_repair_match: can repair materials by using their counterparts
st_itm_desc_part_usable: usable at workshops for part replacement
st_itm_desc_upgr_usable: usable at workshops for installing suitable upgrades
ui_inv_granadelauncher_rifle: Buy under-barrel grenade launcher for rifle (D)
ui_st_err_gs_not_available: Online S.T.A.L.K.E.R. services are not accessible.
ui_inv_survive_surge: Allows you to survive an emission
st_lamp_no_power_left: Head lamp has no power left
st_upd_disconnected: You don't have a Universal Power Device (UPD)
st_ui_workshop_info_state_intro:
The workshop allows you to repair, upgrade and craft items by yourself with the help of proper toolkits.
		
The tools shown above represent the available main toolkits on this workshop, which allow further adjustments for your items.
		
Select one of the tabs to proceed.
st_ui_workshop_info_repair_intro:
You can replace damaged parts of your weapon or outfit by using replacement parts and proper toolkit.
		
Choose the item you want to repair from your inventory.
st_ui_workshop_info_repair_tip_1:
Each item has its own set of parts and materials
		
Grayed parts indicate the lack of identical replacements for them in your inventory.
		
If you have the replacement part and a usable "%s" in your possession, click on the part you wish to replace.
st_ui_workshop_info_repair_warning_1: You don't have any replacement parts in your inventory for this equipment.
st_ui_workshop_info_repair_solution_1: Replacement parts can be obtained mainly through disassembling outfits and weapons.
st_ui_workshop_info_repair_warning_2: You cannot replace parts of this equipment without "%s"
st_ui_workshop_info_repair_solution_2: The majority of mechanics sell such tools. You also may be able to obtain them by other ways.
st_ui_workshop_info_repair_tip_3:
You can pick identical replacement parts "%s" from your inventory.
		
Only parts with higher condition can be used to improve your item.
		
Greyed parts means they have worse condition than your item's part. They are not suitable for proper replacement.
st_ui_workshop_info_repair_warning_3: The replacement part "%s" in your inventory has worse condition compared to the one used by your equipment. It cannot be used.
st_ui_workshop_info_repair_solution_3: Many tools can repair these parts using counterparts. The majority of mechanics sell such tools. You also may be able to obtain them by other ways.
st_ui_workshop_info_repair_tip_4: Replacement parts are ready to be installed, click on "Repair" button to install selected replacements.
st_ui_workshop_info_upgrade_intro:
With the correct toolkits in your possession, you can install upgrades for your weapons and outfits.
		
Choose the item you want to upgrade from your inventory.
st_ui_workshop_info_upgrade_tip_1:
Each upgrade requires a specific toolset of the same type, in addition to usable "%s" to complete the process.
		
Additional conditions need to be met in order for the upgrade to be installed correctly.
		
Click on the upgrade you want to install on your selected item.
		
If the upgrade is disabled, hover on it to see all the missing requirements.
st_ui_workshop_info_upgrade_warning_1: You cannot install upgrades on this equipment without "%s"
st_ui_workshop_info_upgrade_solution_1: The majority of mechanics sell such tools. You also may be able to obtain them by other ways.
st_ui_workshop_info_upgrade_warning_2: There is no available upgrade to be installed.
st_ui_workshop_info_upgrade_solution_2: Hover on an upgrade to see missing requirements.
st_ui_workshop_info_upgrade_tip_3: Upgrade is ready to install. If you're done, click on "Upgrade" button to install selected upgrades.
st_ui_workshop_info_craft_intro:
A lot of materials can be used to craft various kinds of items.
		
Recipes and guides you've acquired through your journey can provide you with more information to craft more items.
		
Select an entry from the craft menu to see craftable items.
st_ui_workshop_info_craft_tip_1: Select the item you want to craft.
st_ui_workshop_info_craft_warning_2: You don't know how to craft "%s" yet.
st_ui_workshop_info_craft_solution_2: Guide books and recipes have enough information regarding items, they will come in handy for learning more about those items.
st_ui_workshop_info_craft_warning_3: "%s" is required to craft this item using its components (availability only, by player or the mechanic)
st_ui_workshop_info_craft_solution_3: Such tools are usually rare to come by, keep an eye on such sets through your travels.
st_ui_workshop_info_craft_warning_4: Your inventory is lacking some necessary components to craft this item.
st_ui_workshop_info_craft_solution_4: Components can be obtained from different items and materials around you. It's advised that you disassemble unneeded items in order to acquire useful components.
st_ui_workshop_info_craft_tip_5: You have all necessary components to craft "%s", select "Craft" button if you wish to continue.
st_ui_workshop_info_state_1:
The workshop allows you to repair, upgrade and craft items by yourself with the help of proper toolkits.
		The tools shown above represent the available main toolkits on this workshop, which allow further adjustments for your items.
		
Select one of the tabs to proceed.
st_ui_workshop_info_repair_1:
You can replace damaged parts of your weapon or outfit by using replacement parts and proper toolkit.
		
Choose the item you want to repair from your inventory.
st_ui_workshop_info_repair_2:
Each item has its own set of parts and materials
		
Grayed parts indicate the lack of identical replacements for them in your inventory.
		
If you have the replacement part and a usable "%s" in your possession, click on the part you wish to replace.
st_ui_workshop_info_repair_3:

st_ui_workshop_info_repair_4: Replacement parts are ready to be installed, click on "Repair" button to install selected replacements.
st_ui_workshop_info_upgr_1:
With the correct toolkits in your possession, you can install upgrades for your weapons and outfits.
		
Choose the item you want to upgrade from your inventory.
st_ui_workshop_info_upgr_2:
Each upgrade requires a specific toolset of the same type, in addition to usable "%s" to complete the process.
		
Additional conditions need to be met in order for the upgrade to be installed correctly.
		
Click on the upgrade you want to install on your selected item.
		
If the upgrade is disabled, hover on it to see all the missing requirements.
st_ui_workshop_info_upgr_3: Upgrade is ready to install. If you're done, click on "Upgrade" button to install selected upgrades.
st_ui_workshop_info_craft_1:
A lot of materials can be used to craft various kinds of items.
		
Recipes and guides you've acquired through your journey can provide you with more information to craft more items.
		
Select an entry from the craft menu to see craftable items.
st_ui_workshop_info_craft_2: Select the item you want to craft.
st_ui_workshop_info_craft_3:
To craft this item, a set of specified components are required.
		
When you don't have the minimum amount of some component, it will be showed in red. Thus preventing the craft procedure.
st_ui_workshop_info_craft_4: You have all necessary components to craft this item, select "Craft" button if you wish to continue.
st_ui_workshop_info_craft_5: You don't know how to craft this item.
st_ui_workshop_info_craft_6: "%s" are required on this workshop so you can craft this item.
st_ui_workshop_no_upgr_1: "%s" is required for this upgrade to be installed.
st_ui_workshop_no_upgr_2: "%s" is required for this upgrade to be installed.
st_ui_workshop_no_upgr_3: This workshop missing the required tools to install this upgrade.
st_ui_workshop_no_upgr_4: An alternative upgrade is already installed in this slot.
st_ui_workshop_no_upgr_5: It's not possible to install this upgrade without installing previous upgrades.
